intro: Aciphylla monroi, commonly known as the mountain pincushion, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage that resembles a pincushion. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, typically clustered at the ends of its stems. Aciphylla monroi is adapted to grow in rocky, alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its unique appearance and ecological significance make it a notable species in New Zealand's flora.
